intro: Luzula erecta var. pallens, commonly known as silver hair grass, is a perennial grass species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and dense clusters of pale blue to silver-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Luzula erecta var. pallens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
